intro: Crotalaria prolifera, commonly known as the spreading crownflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its erect or prostrate growth habit and produces clusters of yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. Crotalaria prolifera is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
